Method Detail

addRestrictedUserToVulnerableDb

public static void addRestrictedUserToVulnerableDb(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                                   java.lang.String userName,
                                                   java.lang.String userPass,
                                                   java.lang.String schemaName,
                                                   java.lang.String tableName)
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException
Used to create a user the application can use to sign on as when interacting with a specific schema on the vulnerable database server

Parameters:
conn - Connection to the vulnerable server
userName - Database user name
userPass - Database user password
schemaName - NNB: schemaName must be escaped for the mySQL codec before entry to this method.
tableName - Table name that this new database user will have access to
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if the user cannot be created

classCreate

public static boolean classCreate(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                                  java.lang.String className,
                                  java.lang.String classYear)
Database procedure just adds this. So this method just prepairs the statement

Parameters:
ApplicationRoot -
className - Class name
classYear - Year of the class in YY/YY. eg 11/12
Returns:

createModule

public static java.lang.String createModule(java.lang.String applicationRoot,
                                            java.lang.String challengeName,
                                            java.lang.String challengeType,
                                            java.lang.String challengeCategory,
                                            java.lang.String challengeSolution)
Used to create a new module entry in the core database. The database will handle creating the new module identifier and module hash. The module has will be returned form the database, and if it does not start will a letter, the applicaiton will update the database to reflect a hash starting with a letter, without safrifising the uniqueness of the hash

Parameters:
applicationRoot - The current running context of the application
challengeName - The name of the module to create
challengeType - The type of module to create
challengeCategory - The category of the new challenge
challengeSolution - The solution of the new challenge
Returns:
The new module identifier

createVulnerableSchema

public static java.lang.String createVulnerableSchema(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                                      java.lang.String challengeName,
                                                      java.lang.String tableName,
                                                      java.lang.String[] attrib,
                                                      int attribAmount)
                                               throws java.sql.SQLException
Used by the challenge builder to create a new schema on the vulnerable database server.

Parameters:
conn - Connection to the vulnerable database server
challengeName - The name of the challenge been created by the builder
tableName - The name of the table to create in the vulnerable schema
attrib - An array of attributes to use when creating the schema's table
attribAmount - The amount of attributes been created in the table
Returns:
The new schema's name if successful
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - Throws this exception if there is an error creating the vulnerable schema

populateVulnerableSchema

public static void populateVulnerableSchema(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                            java.lang.String schemaName,
                                            java.lang.String theTable,
                                            java.lang.String[] data,
                                            java.lang.String[] attrib,
                                            int attribAmount)
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException
Used to populate the vulnerable schemas table with an array of attribues. This method adds ONE row to a table

Parameters:
conn - Connection to the vulnerable database server
schemaName - The name of the schema in the vulnerable database server
theTable - The name of the table to populate
data - The data to use for population
attrib - The list of attributes to be populated
attribAmount - The amount of attributes been populated
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - Thrown if there is a population error

setStoredMessage

public static boolean setStoredMessage(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                                       java.lang.String message,
                                       java.lang.String userId,
                                       java.lang.String moduleId)
Used by CSRF levels to store their CSRF attack string, that will be displayed in a CSRF forum for the class the user is in

Parameters:
ApplicationRoot - The current running context of the application
message - The String they want to store
userId - The identifier of the user in which to store the attack under
moduleId - The module identifier of which to store the message under
Returns:
A boolean value reflecting the success of the funtion

updateCheatSheet

public static boolean updateCheatSheet(java.lang.String applicationRoot,
                                       java.lang.String moduleId,
                                       java.lang.String newSolution)
Used to update a module's cheat sheet

Parameters:
applicationRoot - The current running context of the application
moduleId - The identifier of the module to update
newSolution - The new cheat sheet content
Returns:
A boolean value reflecting the success of the operation

updateCsrfCounter

public static boolean updateCsrfCounter(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                                        java.lang.String moduleId,
                                        java.lang.String userId)
Used to increment a users CSRF counter for CSRF levels.

Parameters:
ApplicationRoot - The current running context of the application.
moduleId - The identifier of the module to increment the counter of
userId - The user to be incremented
Returns:
Boolean reflecting the success of the operation

updatePassword

public static boolean updatePassword(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                                     java.lang.String userName,
                                     java.lang.String currentPassword,
                                     java.lang.String newPassword)
Parameters:
ApplicationRoot - The current running context of the aplication
userName - User name of the user
currentPassword - User's current password
newPassword - New password to use in update
Returns:
ResultSet that contains error details if not successful

updatePlayerClass

public static java.lang.String updatePlayerClass(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                                                 java.lang.String classId,
                                                 java.lang.String playerId)
Updates a PLAYER's class identifier

Parameters:
ApplicationRoot - The current running context of the applicaiton
classId - New class to be assigned to
playerId - Player to be assigned to new class
Returns:
The userName that was updated

updatePlayerClassToNull

public static java.lang.String updatePlayerClassToNull(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                                                       java.lang.String playerId)
Updates a PLAYER's class identifier to null

Parameters:
ApplicationRoot - The current running context of the application
playerId - The identifier of the player to be assigned to class NULL
Returns:
The userName that was updated

updatePlayerResult

public static java.lang.String updatePlayerResult(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                                                  java.lang.String moduleId,
                                                  java.lang.String userId,
                                                  java.lang.String extra,
                                                  int before,
                                                  int after,
                                                  int difficulty)
Updates a users result of a specific module

Parameters:
ApplicationRoot - The current running context of the application
moduleId - Identifier of the module the user is completing
userId - Identifier of the user completing the module
extra - The additional comments submitted in feedback by the user, or if CSRF, the attack string they used
before - The knowledge the user felt before they completed the level
after - The knowledge the user felt after they completed the level
difficulty - The difficulty the user felt they encountered
Returns:
The module name of the module completed by the user

updateUserRole

public static java.lang.String updateUserRole(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                                              java.lang.String playerId,
                                              java.lang.String newRole)
Updates a USER's role

Parameters:
ApplicationRoot - The current running context of the application
playerId - The identifier of the player to update
newRole - Must be "player" or "admin"
Returns:
The user name of the user updated

userCreate

public static boolean userCreate(java.lang.String ApplicationRoot,
                                 java.lang.String classId,
                                 java.lang.String userName,
                                 java.lang.String userPass,
                                 java.lang.String userRole,
                                 java.lang.String userAddress,
                                 boolean tempPass)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Used by many functions to create players or admins

Parameters:
ApplicationRoot -
classId - Cannot be null, relationship depending
userName - Cannot be null
userPass - Cannot be null
userRole - Cannot be null, must be "player" or "admin"
userAddress - Must be unique
tempPass - Wheather or not to set the user with a temporary pass flag
Returns:
A boolean value determining the result of the creation
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - If the creation fails, a Exception is thrown
